title: Darling Point Apartment / Studio ZAWA
description: This project is an exercise in distillation of space, memory, and material. Designed for a downsizer transitioning from a large family home to a waterfront apartment in Darling Point, the renovation transforms a dated 1960s floor plan into a tactile and deeply personal home that balances simplicity with richness.
author: Valeria Silva

title: Chachimbiro House / C/ELC
description: Located in Chachimbiro, Ecuador, it is a project that establishes a respectful and harmonious dialogue with its natural environment. Located in a mountainous setting, near the hot springs of Chachimbiro, the construction has been conceived under an approach that balances the local construction tradition with a contemporary architectural language, generating a welcoming and functional space, which responds to both the needs of the user and the conditions of the place.
author: Pilar Caballero

title: This Once-Dark Home Was Transformed Into a Light-Filled Sanctuary
description: For Le Borgne Rizk Architecture, transforming a dark, compartmentalized house into a light-filled family home meant more than just knocking down walls. Located on Chemin de la Côte-Sainte-Catherine in the Outremont neighborhood of Quebec, this two-storey residence was reimagined with a focus on openness, natural light, and fluid connections to nature. From the foyer to the garden-like kitchen, the design plays with transparency and brightness in smart, poetic ways.
author: Erin

title: Central Bark: A Desk Designed for You and Your Dog
description: Central Bark, designed by Chrissy Fehan for DARRAN, is a workspace solution that quietly rethinks what office furniture can be, especially in pet-friendly workplaces.
author: Erin

title: A Backyard ADU in Silicon Valley Brings Japanese Tranquility
description: building Lab designs a detached accessory dwelling unit (ADU) in Silicon Valley with an accordion roof inspired by a Japanese garden design principle.
author: Caroline Williamson

title: Søren Hvalsøe Garde’s Modern Houseboat Anchors in Copenhagen
description: Søren Hvalsøe Garde designs a floating, two-story houseboat in Copenhagen that feels just as much at home on the water as it would on land.
author: Caroline Williamson
